message_1: A toy company wants to estimate the average weight of their stuffed animals. They randomly select 20 stuffed animals from their inventory and weigh them. The weights in grams are as follows: 23, 27, 34, 58, 65, 80, 85, 98, 116, 130, 145, 165, 178, 189, 201, 225, 244, 256, 289, 312. Calculate the sample mean weight of the stuffed animals.
message_2:
To calculate the sample mean weight of the stuffed animals, we need to add up all the weights and then divide by the number of stuffed animals (which is 20 in this case).

Sample mean = (Σ weights) / n

where Σ weights is the sum of all the weights and n is the number of stuffed animals.

Sample mean = (23 + 27 + 34 + 58 + 65 + 80 + 85 + 98 + 116 + 130 + 145 + 165 + 178 + 189 + 201 + 225 + 244 + 256 + 289 + 312) / 20

Sample mean = (2930) / 20

Sample mean = 146.5 grams

The sample mean weight of the stuffed animals is 146.5 grams.
